intro: Richeria grandis var. genuina, commonly known as the velvetleaf or velvetleaf tree, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a velvety texture. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are clustered in spikes, and it is often found in moist, shaded environments. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive foliage.
